pull.title: Refactor HaveKeys to early return on false result
pull.body: This consists in a trivial change where the return type of `HaveKeys()` is now `bool` meaning that it returns whether all keys are in the keystore, and early returns when one isn't.

events.message: Refactor HaveKeys to early return on false result

events.body: utACK 5bdbbdc0967626a763c836a55dc7d018c15c10f2. To be sure, though, there's no concern about side channel attacks here, e.g. #10564?
Do you think starting the loop from a random index helps?

@ryanofsky @promag I don't think there is any reason to aim for constant time here. Someone who can observe code branches taken can presumably already derive which coins are yours. Trying to avoid that is nearly impossible (and certainly not feasible without a complete redesign).
utACK if non-constant time is not an issue
